intro: Vicia incana, commonly known as hoary vetch, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant features hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive silvery-white pubescence. Its flowers are small, pea-shaped, and usually appear in clusters, ranging in color from pink to purple. Vicia incana is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
